intro: Diplopterys includens, commonly known as the Amazonian yoco, is a climbing shrub native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its alternate, simple leaves with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its traditional use in folk medicine, it has gained attention for its potential pharmacological properties.
